title: Der Sturm (opera)
text:
(The tempest) is a German-language <a href="opera">opera</a> in three acts and an epilogue by the Swiss composer <a href="Frank%20Martin%20%28composer%29">Frank Martin</a> to a <a href="libretto">libretto</a> based on the <a href="August%20Wilhelm%20Schlegel">Schlegel</a>/<a href="Ludwig%20Tieck">Tieck</a> German translation of <a href="William%20Shakespeare">Shakespeare</a>'s play "<a href="The%20Tempest">The Tempest</a>". Martin's only opera was premiered at the <a href="Vienna%20State%20Opera">Vienna State Opera</a> on 17 June 1956. The role of <a href="Prospero">Prospero</a> was originally conceived for <a href="Dietrich%20Fischer-Dieskau">Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau</a>, but illness prevented him participating, although Casaglia lists Fischer-Dieskau in the role of Sebastian, but a playbill for the premiere lists in that role.
The word setting is <a href="through-composition">through-composed</a> "<a href="parlando">parlando</a>", with few set pieces, most of which belong to Prospero.
